data.title: Small fine arts museum
data.text: This local museum at Santa Clara displayed art from one or two artists when I visited...some sculptures can also be found round the front and back of the building..

data.title: Only "Serious" California Artists Need Apply
data.text: On through May 29th at the Triton Museum, the 2016 Statewide 2D Competition and Exhibition contains many masterfully rendered and technically tough to execute pieces.  Prize photographs squeeze the air out of architecturally engineered environments. Beautifully rendered, bloodless art  fills this show. It's hardly representative of our regional art. This cool take on art from a joyfully irreverent, rambunctious state belongs somewhere else...a wing of the Computer Museum? The CA plein air artists have no room here?, Did all remnants of Figurative Art and Funk Art die to be replaced by safe hyper realism?   The Triton Museum is lightly populated so that you will have plenty of opportunity to walk back from the pieces and enjoy them to the fullest. Then head over to the San Jose Museum of Art, Cantor Art Museum at Stanford or Santa Cruz Museum of Art & History to expand your viewpoint of "California" Art.

data.title: Enjoyed Seeing Pro Football's Hall of Fame Largest Traveling Exhibit
data.text:
Santa  Clara is the host city for Super Bowl 50.  The Triton Art Museum in Santa Clara hosted the free event Gridiron Glory: The Best of the Pro Football Hall of Fame exhibit.

We had so much fun seeing the various historical football jerseys of players.  We saw the Super Bowl trophy.  There was exhibits on the history of the Super Bowl.  

The exhibits included:

1) The Pioneers - It included historic photos and jerseys.

2) The Great Moments - They had many videos to see which was fun.

3) The Dynasties - Teams that were dynasty teams such as the San Francisco 49ers.

4) Pro Football Hall to Equality

5) The Science of Football - An interactive video on football and science

6) and other exhibits:  Super Bowl Records, Champions, and Football as a Way of Life,

I especially liked the exhibit on instant replays which was a game where you got to decide what the final out come would be on a controversial referee call.

It was very well done.  I had been to the Pro Football Hall of Fame in Ohio  While the traveling display was smaller (of course), I still thought it was a very good display and worthy to see.  The staff was welcoming and friendly.

Its a temporary exhibit.  It was free.  I had no problem finding a parking spot on the street.

data.title: Interesting local Museum
data.text: This museum was interesting.  It took less than two hours to go through, but the exhibits were and intresting combination of art and photography.

data.title: Fine Art
data.text: It has been a year since my last visit.  However, I go here whenever there is an exhibit I am interesting in viewing.  This museum has never been crowded when I have gone, and I recommend it on this basis.

data.title: Beautiful museum with O.K. art
data.text:
The building is gorgeous -- designed by a San Francisco architect (the staff person wasn't sure who). In back is a park and some sculpture. I'll post photos.

The museum is celebrating its 50th anniversary. (The building is newer.) The main exhibition was "50 artists to watch." Art was from regional artists; much of it wasn't the same class as you'd see at the nearby San Jose Museum of Art or the Cantor Art Center in Palo Alto (at Stanford). But I was glad I stopped by this beautiful, peaceful spot.

data.title: Whoops gave the wrong review to the De sassait
data.text:
gave the De Saissat museum this review. I have not been to the De Saissat

Have not been, looks interesting

data.title: interesting museum
data.text:
This is a small museum but I did find three interesting exhibitions which I enjoyed very much. One of them is with work of Charles Eckart which will be on view until the 19th April.

The entree is free but you can leaf some money in the box. 
I did spend almost two hours there.

data.title: nice receptionist
data.text: we stopped by for asking if any park nearby.... and the lady was very kind enough to explain the closest one..... art works were great too

data.title: fun, fun, fun and FREE!  (nice place for a date!)
data.text:
This place must have a pile of money in a trust because it is beautiful: the site, the building, the art, the shows, the programs, all are beautiful.  The docents are very kind to children.  The sculpture garden is located a 200 feet from a playground.  
Pack a lunch for the family and then head over this place any day of the week.  It's almost always empty, but the art is just plain a cut above.  I think if it were nearer the university, it would get more traffic.  

It's a modern art museum, all types of mediums.  Clean and very chic.   Would make a cute first date, since there are some nice places to sit and talk and look at the art.  

There are several fountains plus the Saint Claire fountain across the street.  Walk over there.  Safe for kids or slower people.  Always plenty of free parking.    Park out front near the doors--there is no entry from the sculpture garden.  

Gift shop is small and not particularly spectacular, but you can buy a nice little momento there.  Gift-shop pricing…

I have gone here monthly or so for years.  It's a timeless classic of modern art.   I take long-term guests (something free to do that feels like an outing, and you could even get a little dressed up and not feel silly doing so). 

I've taken the kids to a few of the free art programs--they are a bit packed and not very inspired.  But they are free and there is a lot of space outside and several adventures to take.

data.title: Modern art
data.text: A two gallery facility for modern art as well as large treed garden with art.  Triton also sponsers shows and contests.

data.title: For a Free City Art Museum it is excellent
data.text: Triton Museum of Art is a free art museum, while it is relatively small, it has some impressive art pieces.  There is a nice outdoor statue garden as well.  I spent about 1/2 hour here to see the art displays and statue garden.  There is also a gift shop at the museum.  I parked for free on the street; there is also a small parking lot a bit further away by the historic homes just north of the art museum.

data.title: Surprising Treasure
data.text: When we moved to Santa Clara, we spent a few weekends visiting the area museums. We were very impressed with the Triton. The exhibit there at the time was wonderful and the gift shop was irresistible. Even the surrounding grounds and buildings were worth a browse. Overall, a very enjoyable afternoon.

data.title: Beautiful artwork
data.text: I took my niece and nephew to the museum last week during their visit it was really nice.  First of all, it's free, my kind of entertainment, but also, there is artwork from several different artist whom all have amazing talent.  What was awesome was that my niece and nephew, even though they are young, 10 and 12 yrs old, they enjoy art.  They have painting, sculptures, and even photos, at least some look like photo art.   The only thing I didn't care too much for was the naked artwork or the women, in fact I got so embarrassed.  But I tried to make the best of it and I apologized to them because I'm not sure if my brother would have approved.  What I told them was that there is different types of art and what they saw before them, some people consider to be art.  And to be honest, if it was just me, I would of had no problem, because this is art, but because I had two young kids with me, it took me off guard.  I wish that there was a posting or something to warn you ahead of time so you can prepare the kids. But other than that, we had a great time and took lots of pictures.  Don't forget to see the sculptures outside.

data.title: Intimate Museum in a Park Setting
data.text: If you are in the area, check out the free Triton Museum.  Art exhibits rotate and there are several art events a year in the park surrounding the museum.

data.title: It's free!
data.text:
It's small and cute and...FREE!!!!!

Right next to Santa Clara's City Hall and other buildings full of history.

The museum itself houses three exhibit rooms that contains local artists' work. The galleries change every few months or so. The main room is by far the largest with a high ceiling  and plenty of light coming through the windows. The walls are painted a boring cream white but is necessary when displaying art pieces. You don't want the wall to be the center of attention now, if that was the case, then there's something wrong with the picture, lolz.

They do have a gift shop with a really nice lady that works there, who is happy to answer any questions you have of the place. She is also very honest. I asked her if it was okay to take pictures for my blog and she admitted that photography is not allowed but people do it anyways so it was okay. I ended up taking pics of the main room to show how spacious it is. =/ She told me that people hold their wedding receptions or after parties here.

There is also pamphlets next to the shop that gives not only the information of the museum but also of the other buildings surrounding it.

data.title: 地味だが良い美術館
data.text: サンタクララ市役所の向かいにある美術館で、現代美術の秀作が多い。あまり行く人も多くないらしく、とても静かで庭もきれいなので、ゆっくり鑑賞できる。
